resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #4407: ARROW-5435: [Java]IntervalYearVector#getObject should return Period with both year and month
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4407
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-5435](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5435).
   IntervalYearVector#getObject today return Period with specific month. However, this vector stores interval (years and months, e.g. 2 years and 3 months is stored as 27(total months)), it should return Period with both years and months(now only months is assigned). 
   
   As shown in the example above, now it return Period(27 months), I think it should return Period(2 years, 3 months).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jacques-n commented on issue #4407: ARROW-5435: [Java]IntervalYearVector#getObject should return Period with both year and month
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4407#issuecomment-496976541
 
 
   -1. This seems like something that should be done in application layer, not Arrow. The internal representation is months, not years and months and we shouldn't be doing arbitrary math between equivalent periods in the base impl.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

tianchen92 commented on issue #4407: ARROW-5435: [Java]IntervalYearVector#getObject should return Period with both year and month
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4407#issuecomment-497171477
 
 
   @jacques-n Two questions:
   1. Before [ARROW-2015](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2015), getMethod return Period with year and month, Was it intentional to change that now return Period with total month?
   2. getAsStringBuilder returns string like "2 years 3 months", this should also be done in application layer and here just return "27 months"?
   thanks!
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org
